snippet: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl spent just short of a month in basic training with the United States Coast Guard in early 2006 before he was given an administrative discharge, military officials said.
abstract: Military officials say Sgt Bowe Bergdahl spent four weeks in basic training with the United States Coast Guard in early 2006 before he was given an administrative discharge; disclosure raises new questions about whether Bergdahl should have been allowed to enlist in the Army and whether he had to be given waiver to join either because he had previously washed out of boot camp or because of concerns about his emotional fitness.

byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. reported from New York, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl spent just short of a month in basic training with the United States Coast Guard in early 2006 before he was given an administrative discharge, military officials said.

headline.main: Before Army, P.O.W. Failed at Coast Guard Training
headline.print_headline: Before Army, P.O.W. Failed at Coast Guard Training

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
